meanings.definition: To divide or separate into compartments.
meanings.sent1: I will compart my snacks into different containers.
meanings.sent2: She likes to compart her toys by color.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to compart their ideas into groups.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to compart thoughts into neat little boxes.
meanings.sent5: The organizer helps me compart my clothes efficiently.

meanings.definition: A small compartment or section within a larger space.
meanings.sent1: The jewelry box has a tiny compart for rings.
meanings.sent2: The toolbox has a separate compart for screws and nails.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored nuts in every compart of the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a compart, each emotion in its own space.
meanings.sent5: The backpack has a special compart for laptops.
